value.title: Debugging DAX measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to debug a DAX measure that returns an incorrect result by using different techniques, with and without external tools. Article and download: https://sql.bi/782334?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing ALLSELECTED in DAX
value.excerpt: Introduction to ALLSELECTED, which is an extremely complex function to use in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760153?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Optimizing fusion optimization for DAX measures
value.excerpt: How to implement a DAX measure to run faster than what you get from the built-in horizontal fusion optimization.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/792359?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Rolling average with working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This article shows how to compute a rolling average (useful to smooth out charts) taking into account only the working days.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/757611?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. Article and video: https://sql.bi/54337?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.

value.title: Multiple Scenario Analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to use map multiple What-If Parameters to do perform insightful scenario analysis using Power BI Contact me on Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #181: Can't covert text into dates using DAX? Here is why...
value.excerpt: You should use power query to convert text into dates in power bi, but if you have a direct query or live connection and you need to do it in DAX, here is a tutorial of what works, what doesnt and what to watch for.  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
